metadata.Title: CVE-2017-3070 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Adobe Flash Player versions 25.0.0.148 and earlier have an exploitable memory corruption vulnerability in the ConvolutionFilter class. Successful exploitation could lead to arbitrary code execution.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-3070` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

flashplugin-downloader - 25.0.0.171ubuntu0.14.04.1
flashplugin-installer - 25.0.0.171ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: flashplugin-nonfree package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '25.0.0.171ubuntu0.14.04.1').
